{{Infobox football biography |name = Kamil Grabara |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Kamil Grabara |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1999|1|8|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Ruda Śląska]], Poland |height = {{convert|1.95|m|abbr=on}} |position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] |currentclub = [[Aarhus Gymnastikforening|AGF]]
(on loan from [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]) |clubnumber = 73 |years1 = 2015 |clubs1 = [[Ruch Chorzów|Ruch II Chorzów]] |caps1 = 1 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2018– |clubs2 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |caps2 = 0 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2019– |clubs3 = → [[Aarhus Gymnastikforening|AGF]] (loan) |caps3 = 3 |goals3 = 0 |youthyears1 = |youthclubs1 = Wawel Wirek |youthyears2 = |youthclubs2 = Stadion Śląski Chorzów |youthyears3 = 2012–2016 |youthclubs3 = [[Ruch Chorzów]] |youthyears4 = 2016– |youthclubs4 = [[Liverpool F.C. Reserves and Academy|Liverpool]] | nationalyears1 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam1 = [[Poland national under-17 football team|Poland U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 9 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2016 | nationalteam2 = [[Poland national under-18 football team|Poland U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2017– | nationalteam3 = [[Poland national under-21 football team|Poland U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 2 | nationalgoals3 = 0 |club-update = 16:56, 23 August 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kamil Grabara''' (born 8 January 1999) is a Polish professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Aarhus Gymnastikforening|AGF]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]]. ==Club career== Grabara joined Liverpool ahead of the [[2016–17 Liverpool F.C. season|2016–17 season]] from [[Ruch Chorzów]] for £250,000,{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jan/06/kamil-grabara-liverpool-sign-teenage-goalkeeper-ruch-warsaw|title=Liverpool sign teenage Polish keeper Kamil Grabara from Ruch Chorzow|first=Andy|last=Hunter|date=6 January 2016|publisher=|via=www.theguardian.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/team/first-team/player/kamil-grabara|title=Profile|accessdate=23 August 2018|publisher=Liverpool F.C.}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/who-kamil-grabara-liverpool-goalkeeper-12996084|title=Everything you need to know about Liverpool youngster Kamil Grabara|last=Smith|first=Alex|date=2018-07-28|work=mirror|access-date=2018-10-30}} and was promoted to the first team squad for the [[2018–19 Liverpool F.C. season|2018–19 season]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-turn-teenage-goalkeepers-kamil-14962857|title=Liverpool turn to teenage goalkeepers against Man Utd|last=Walsh|first=Kristian|date=2018-07-27|work=liverpoolecho|access-date=2018-10-30}} He trains regularly with the first-team squad at [[Melwood]] and made his maiden senior outing in a pre-season friendly against [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere]] in July 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/meet-kamil-grabara-liverpools-fearless-14964745|title=Meet 'fearless' Grabara, the teenage keeper liked by Gerrard & United|first=James|last=Pearce|date=28 July 2018|website=liverpoolecho}} On 26 September 2018, Grabara was named on the substitutes’ bench for the first time in Liverpool’s 2-1 [[Football League Cup|Carabao Cup]] defeat to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at Anfield.{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45569330|title=Liverpool 1-2 Chelsea - BBC Sport|}} On 6 January 2019, Grabara joined [[Aarhus Gymnastikforening|AGF]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/academy/333040-kamil-grabara-aarhus-liverpool-loan|title=Kamil Grabara joins AGF Aarhus on loan|publisher=Liverpool F.C.|date=6 January 2019|accessdate=6 January 2019}} ==International career== Grabara is a [[Poland under-21 national football team|Polish U21]] international having made his debut against Denmark on 14 November 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2019/teams/team=200109/index.html|title=Poland - U21 EURO|first=|last=UEFA.com|website=UEFA.com}} ==Style of play== Grabara is an accomplished, all-round goalkeeper, able to dominate the penalty area, pull out top reflex saves, play out from the back with composure and, as he develops, operate as a sweeper.{{cite web|url=https://www.thisisanfield.com/2018/07/kamil-grabara-liverpool-youngster-with-the-confidence-to-become-future-no-1/|title=Who is young Liverpool goalkeeper Kamil Grabara?|date=15 July 2018|publisher=}} ==Personal life== Grabara is from [[Ruda Śląska]], in south [[Poland]]. He is the second Pole to play in goal for the Reds after Champions League hero [[Jerzy Dudek]].{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/who-kamil-grabara-liverpool-goalkeeper-12996084|title=Everything you need to know about Liverpool youngster Kamil Grabara|first=Alex|last=Smith|date=28 July 2018|website=mirror}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://www.liverpoolfc.com/team/first-team/player/kamil-grabar Liverpool F.C. profile] * {{90minut|31168}} {{Aarhus Gymnastikforening squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Grabara, Kamil}} [[Category:1999 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Polish footballers]] [[Category:Polish expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Polish people]] [[Category:Polish sportspeople]] [[Category:Association football goalkeepers]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in England]] [[Category:Polish expatriate sportspeople in England]] [[Category:Liverpool F.C. players]] [[Category:Aarhus Gymnastikforening players]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Ruda Śląska]] {{Poland-footy-goalkeeper-stub}}
